meanings.definition: A category of books that are neither bestsellers nor backlist titles.
meanings.sent1: In the bookstore, you can find many interesting stories in the midlist section.
meanings.sent2: The midlist books may not be as popular as bestsellers, but they still have their own charm.
meanings.sent3: I chuckled when I saw the midlist novels trying to stand out among the bestsellers.
meanings.sent4: The midlist is like a hidden treasure trove waiting to be discovered by readers.
meanings.sent5: The midlist offers a diverse selection of books for those looking for something unique.

meanings.definition: To place a book in the middle of a list based on sales or popularity.
meanings.sent1: Authors hope their publishers will midlist their books to give them a chance to shine.
meanings.sent2: When a new book is released, the publisher may choose to midlist it to gauge its success.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how publishers decide to midlist books based on market trends.
meanings.sent4: Placing a book in the midlist is like giving it a spotlight in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: Authors eagerly anticipate the opportunity to midlist their works for wider exposure.
